vulnerability.name: USN-4365-2
vulnerability.description: USN-4365-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Bind. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and 14.04 ESM.   Original advisory details:   Lior Shafir, Yehuda Afek, and Anat Bremler-Barr discovered that Bind  incorrectly limited certain fetches. A remote attacker could possibly use  this issue to cause Bind to consume resources, leading to a denial of  service, or possibly use Bind to perform a reflection attack.  (CVE-2020-8616)   Tobias Klein discovered that Bind incorrectly handled checking TSIG  validity. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Bind to crash,  resulting in a denial of service, or possibly perform other attacks.  (CVE-2020-8617)

statements.status_notes: Several security issues were fixed in Bind. Available with Ubuntu Pro.
